qas.question: What is a reactionary thing to limit formalism's meaning to?
What sort of quest lacks purpose?
What ends up being reduced in quality by this quest?
What is a reactionary thing to expand formalism's meaning to?
What sort of quest defines purpose?
What ends up being maximized in quality by this quest?

context: To restrict the meaning of (architectural) formalism to <a0_0><b3_0>art for art's sake<b3_0/><a0_0/> is not only reactionary; it can also be a purposeless <a1_0><b4_0>quest for perfection or originality<b4_0/><a1_0/> which degrades <a2_0><b5_0>form<b5_0/><a2_0/> into a mere instrumentality".
